title.value: M-TAG: A modular teaching-aid for Geant4
title.justification: The title is directly taken from the title of the research article as provided.
title.quote: Research article M-TAG: A modular teaching-aid for Geant4

extractions.description: This paper introduces M-TAG, a modular user-code teaching aid developed for the Geant4 simulation toolkit. M-TAG is designed to help users gradually learn Geant4 by providing pre-built modules and allowing for the addition of new geometric components and detector elements without recompiling the code. This tool aids in the design and testing of radiation detectors for medical applications and has been validated through various simulation projects.

type.justification: The paper involves the development and validation of the M-TAG teaching aid through practical simulations and comparisons with existing data, indicating it is empirical research.
type.quote: To validate M-TAG, simulations were performed to calculate the range of positrons in water... These results were compared to literature values.

name.justification: The primary application and testing of the M-TAG teaching aid focus on medical physics, particularly in the context of radiation simulations and medical detector development.
name.quote: Geant4 is widely used in medical research... in fields such as medical imaging, radiobiology and medical physics.

name.justification: The M-TAG teaching aid is specifically designed to assist with learning and conducting radiation transport simulations using the Geant4 toolkit.
name.quote: Geant4 is a versatile Monte Carlo radiation transport simulation toolkit with a steep learning curve.

name.justification: The development of M-TAG is centered around creating an educational tool to assist new learners in understanding the Geant4 toolkit, thus falling under the realm of teaching aids.
name.quote: M-TAG also provides basic validated examples for some common detector development tasks.

name.justification: Penelope is used as a physics model for electromagnetic interactions within the M-TAG framework.
name.quote: M-TAG uses a validated Geant4 modular physics list, including the Geant4 Penelope reference physics list.
